definition: Zhang Wentian (1900-1976), CCP party leader and theorist
surname Zhang
to open up/to spread/sheet of paper/classifier for flat objects, sheet/classifier for votes
to hear/news/well-known/famous/reputation/fame/to smell/to sniff at
surname Wen
day/sky/heaven

sentences.english: Chang Wen-tien, too, participated in Kao Kang's factional activities.
sentences.chinese: 张闻天也参加了高岗的宗派活动。

sentences.english: Zhang Wentain's thinking on the masses route is extremely rich.
sentences.chinese: 张闻天关于群众路线的思想极为丰富。

sentences.english: However, Huili Conference had influenced Zhang Wentian and Peng Dehuai to some extent.
sentences.chinese: 会理会议也给张闻天和彭德怀带来一定影响。

sentences.english: The fourth part points out its great significance.
sentences.chinese: 第四部分指出张闻天党建思想的重大意义。

sentences.english: Zhang Wentian was an outstanding proletarian revolutionist and theorist.
sentences.chinese: 张闻天是一位杰出的无产阶级革命家和理论家。

sentences.english: Zhang Wen day is a great proletarian revolutionist not only.
sentences.chinese: 张闻天不仅是一个伟大的无产阶级革命家。

definition: Liu Shaoqi (1898-1969), Chinese communist leader, a martyr of the Cultural Revolution
Yang Shangkun (1907-1998), former president of PRC and military leader
Li Fuchun (1900-1975), communist politician
Zhou Enlai (1898-1976), Chinese communist leader, prime minister 1949-1976
Dong Biwu (1886-1975), one of the founders of the Chinese communist party
Zhu De (1886-1976), communist leader and founder of the People's Liberation Army
Peng Zhen (1902-1997), Chinese communist leader
Mao Zedong (1893-1976), Chinese communist leader
Bo Yibo (1908-2007), ranking PRC politician, served on State Council from 1950s to 1980s as colleague of Deng Xiaoping
Zhang Guotao (1897-1979), Chinese communist leader in the 1920s and 1930s, defected to Guomindang in 1938
Hu Yaobang (1915-1989), Chinese politician
Chen Yi (1901-1972), communist general and politician, Marshal of PLA from 1955, Mayor of Shanghai in 1950s, PRC foreign minister 1958-1972

Qu Qiubai (1899-1935), politician, Soviet expert of the Chinese communists at time of Soviet influence, publisher and Russian translator, captured and executed by Guomindang at the time of the Long March
Xiang Ying (1898-1941), communist general involved in forming the New Fourth Army 新四軍, killed in 1941 during the New Fourth Army incident 皖南事变
Li Xiannian (1909-1992), PRC general and politician
Chen Boda (1904-1989), communist party theorist, interpreter of Maoism
